intro: Matelea capillacea, commonly known as the silky matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine, silky hairs. Matelea capillacea thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
